channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023110616
item.description:
Report E-2023110616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: CHESTERFIELD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Chesterfield, Michigan regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of UN1263 PAINT 3, III from (1) IBC tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Contractors were able to clean the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55- Gallon DM which was then staged on-site by the contractor in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023111132
item.description:
Report X-2023111132

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This was a package found to be leaking during unload on door 17. It was shipped on its side. Furthermore, a manager slammed the package to the ground on its side. The caps on all 4 containers leaked. The package was placed into a hazmat tote and placed into the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort. DescribePack: The caps on all 4 containers leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a hazmat tote and placed into the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort.

item.title: Report X-2023110748
item.description:
Report X-2023110748

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was reported as leaking, upon investigation the leaking hazmat was placed into the hazmat tote, I placed the hazmat into the hazmat cage until I could process the hazmat. DescribePack: One of the caps had not been secured at the time of investigation, one of the gallons had leaked because of the improper seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed with corresponding orientation in the hazmat tote.

item.title: Report E-2023110351
item.description:
Report E-2023110351

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Environmental Restoration personnel observed a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor impacted by approximately one (1) cup of released material from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to a nail puncture during forklift operations. Environmental Restoration personnel deployed Soda Ash to the impacted area and recovered the neutralized material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged 1-gallon plastic jug along with three (3) impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110339
item.description:
Report E-2023110339

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDE experienced a UN1206 R-822 release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of material released to a 2’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 2’ x 3’ area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail was then containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110271
item.description:
Report E-2023110271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN2735 ACTech 2170 FC Part B release from a 2.4-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of Part B released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the cardboard on the trailer floor due to being crushed. A second pail containing Part A was also damaged, releasing approximately 0.25-gallons. Spill pads were utilized to wipe up the released product. The damaged pails and impacted rags were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110517
item.description:
Report X-2023110517

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: LAKE ORION
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was traveling down the non-conveyable belt. The package appears to have been pushed off at the truck location where it was to be loaded. The impact caused one of the glass jugs inside to shatter and the liquid leaked out onto the floor. QA was called on the radio to contain the leak and clean up the leakage. DescribePack: The glass jug inside the box shattered due to impact with the concrete floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used to soak up the liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023110328
item.description:
Report X-2023110328

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WITH NO OUTER CARTON LABELING EXCEPT TRACKING AND ADDRESS WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN A LITHIUM BATTERY INSIDE. THE BATTERY WAS CONTAINED IN SIDE ANOTHER BOX WHICH DID HAVE DOT BATTERY LABELS NUMBER 9,RED AND YELLOW DANGEROUS GOODS UPS ACCEPTED,CARGO CRAFT ONLY,AND IATA PAPER WORK COMING FROM HONG KONG.THE OVERBOX HAD NO INDICATIONS OF INNER CONTENTS.PACKAGE IS BEING HELD IN THE HAZMAT AUDITOR HOLDING CAGE FOR REGULATORY INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2023110327
item.description:
Report X-2023110327

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: WYOMING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE WAS LOADING TRAILER WHEN THEY CAME ACROSS THE PACKAGE RELEASING A VAPOR. RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED AN UPON THEIR INSPECTION THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO BE COMPRESSED AIR AND GOING OFF IN THE PAKCAGE DUE TO IMPROPER PACKAGING. FURTHER INSPECTION LED US TO FIND THAT THE CONTENTS WERE A REGULATED ITEM (1,1-DIFLUOROETHANE UN1030) AS THEY ARE AN AEROSOL BUT THE OUTTER PACKAGING WAS NOT MARKED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL. ADG WAS CONTACTED
